fields.name: node
fields.description: Fetches an object given its ID

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of an object

fields.name: feeds
fields.description: Get all available feeds

fields.name: agencies
fields.description: Get all agencies

fields.name: ticketTypes
fields.description: Return list of available ticket types

fields.name: agency
fields.description: Get a single agency based on agency ID, i.e. value of field `gtfsId` (ID format is `FeedId:StopId`)

fields.name: stops
fields.description: Get all stops

args.name: ids
args.description: Return stops with these ids

args.name: name
args.description: Query stops by this name

fields.name: stopsByBbox
fields.description: Get all stops within the specified bounding box

args.name: minLat
args.description: Southern bound of the bounding box

args.name: minLon
args.description: Western bound of the bounding box

args.name: maxLat
args.description: Northern bound of the bounding box

args.name: maxLon
args.description: Eastern bound of the bounding box

args.name: agency
args.description: Deprecated, use argument `feeds` instead

args.name: feeds
args.description: List of feed ids from which stops are returned

fields.name: stopsByRadius
fields.description: Get all stops within the specified radius from a location. The returned type is a Relay connection (see https://facebook.github.io/relay/graphql/connections.htm). The stopAtDistance type has two values: stop and distance.

args.name: lat
args.description: Latitude of the location (WGS 84)

args.name: lon
args.description: Longitude of the location (WGS 84)

args.name: radius
args.description: Radius (in meters) to search for from the specified location. Note that this is walking distance along streets and paths rather than a geographic distance.

args.name: agency
args.description: Deprecated, use argument `feeds` instead

args.name: feeds
args.description: List of feed ids from which stops are returned

fields.name: nearest
fields.description: Get all places (stops, stations, etc. with coordinates) within the specified radius from a location. The returned type is a Relay connection (see https://facebook.github.io/relay/graphql/connections.htm). The placeAtDistance type has two fields: place and distance. The search is done by walking so the distance is according to the network of walkable streets and paths.

args.name: lat
args.description: Latitude of the location (WGS 84)

args.name: lon
args.description: Longitude of the location (WGS 84)

args.name: maxDistance
args.description: Maximum distance (in meters) to search for from the specified location. Note that this is walking distance along streets and paths rather than a geographic distance. Default is 2000m

args.name: maxResults
args.description: Maximum number of results. Search is stopped when this limit is reached. Default is 20.

args.name: filterByPlaceTypes
args.description: Only return places that are one of these types, e.g. `STOP` or `BICYCLE_RENT`

args.name: filterByModes
args.description: Only return places that are related to one of these transport modes. This argument can be used to return e.g. only nearest railway stations or only nearest places related to bicycling.

args.name: filterByIds
args.description: Only include places that match one of the given GTFS ids.

fields.name: departureRow
fields.description: Get a single departure row based on its ID (ID format is `FeedId:StopId:PatternId`)

fields.name: stop
fields.description: Get a single stop based on its ID, i.e. value of field `gtfsId` (ID format is `FeedId:StopId`)

fields.name: station
fields.description: Get a single station based on its ID, i.e. value of field `gtfsId` (format is `FeedId:StopId`)

fields.name: stations
fields.description: Get all stations

args.name: ids
args.description: Only return stations that match one of the ids in this list

args.name: name
args.description: Query stations by name

fields.name: routes
fields.description: Get all routes

args.name: ids
args.description: Only return routes with these ids

args.name: feeds
args.description: Only return routes with these feedIds

args.name: name
args.description: Query routes by this name

args.name: modes
args.description: Deprecated, use argument `transportModes` instead.

args.name: transportModes
args.description: Only include routes, which use one of these modes

fields.name: route
fields.description: Get a single route based on its ID, i.e. value of field `gtfsId` (format is `FeedId:RouteId`)

fields.name: trips
fields.description: Get all trips

args.name: feeds
args.description: Only return trips with these feedIds

fields.name: trip
fields.description: Get a single trip based on its ID, i.e. value of field `gtfsId` (format is `FeedId:TripId`)

fields.name: fuzzyTrip
fields.description: Finds a trip matching the given parameters. This query type is useful if the id of a trip is not known, but other details uniquely identifying the trip are available from some source (e.g. MQTT vehicle positions).

args.name: route
args.description: id of the route

args.name: direction
args.description:
Direction of the trip, possible values: 0, 1 or -1.  
 -1 indicates that the direction is irrelevant, i.e. in case the route has trips only in one direction. See field `directionId` of Pattern.

args.name: date
args.description: Departure date of the trip, format: YYYY-MM-DD

args.name: time
args.description: Departure time of the trip, format: seconds since midnight of the departure date

fields.name: cancelledTripTimes
fields.description: Get cancelled TripTimes.

args.name: feeds
args.description: Feed feedIds (e.g. ["HSL"]).

args.name: routes
args.description: Route gtfsIds (e.g. ["HSL:1098"]).

args.name: patterns
args.description: TripPattern codes (e.g. ["HSL:1098:1:01"]).

args.name: minDate
args.description: Only cancelled trip times scheduled to run on minDate or after are returned. Format: "2019-12-23" or "20191223".

args.name: maxDate
args.description: Only cancelled trip times scheduled to run on maxDate or before are returned. Format: "2019-12-23" or "20191223".

args.name: minDepartureTime
args.description: Only cancelled trip times that have first stop departure time at minDepartureTime or after are returned. Format: seconds since midnight of minDate.

args.name: maxDepartureTime
args.description: Only cancelled trip times that have first stop departure time at maxDepartureTime or before are returned. Format: seconds since midnight of maxDate.

args.name: minArrivalTime
args.description: Only cancelled trip times that have last stop arrival time at minArrivalTime or after are returned. Format: seconds since midnight of minDate.

args.name: maxArrivalTime
args.description: Only cancelled trip times that have last stop arrival time at maxArrivalTime or before are returned. Format: seconds since midnight of maxDate.

fields.name: patterns
fields.description: Get all patterns

fields.name: pattern
fields.description: Get a single pattern based on its ID, i.e. value of field `code` (format is `FeedId:RouteId:DirectionId:PatternVariantNumber`)

fields.name: clusters
fields.description: Get all clusters

fields.name: cluster
fields.description: Get a single cluster based on its ID, i.e. value of field `gtfsId`

fields.name: alerts
fields.description: Get all active alerts

args.name: feeds
args.description: Only return alerts in these feeds

args.name: severityLevel
args.description: Only return alerts with these severity levels

args.name: effect
args.description: Only return alerts with these effects

args.name: cause
args.description: Only return alerts with these causes

args.name: route
args.description: Only return alerts affecting these routes

args.name: stop
args.description: Only return alerts affecting these stops

fields.name: serviceTimeRange
fields.description: Get the time range for which the API has data available

fields.name: bikeRentalStations
fields.description: Get all bike rental stations

fields.name: bikeRentalStation
fields.description: Get a single bike rental station based on its ID, i.e. value of field `stationId`

fields.name: bikeParks
fields.description: Get all bike parks

fields.name: bikePark
fields.description: Get a single bike park based on its ID, i.e. value of field `bikeParkId`

fields.name: carParks
fields.description: Get all car parks

args.name: ids
args.description:
Return car parks with these ids.  
 **Note:** if an id is invalid (or the car park service is unavailable) the returned list will contain `null` values.

fields.name: carPark
fields.description: Get a single car park based on its ID, i.e. value of field `carParkId`

fields.name: viewer
fields.description: Needed until https://github.com/facebook/relay/issues/112 is resolved

fields.name: plan
fields.description: Plans an itinerary from point A to point B based on the given arguments

args.name: date
args.description: Date of departure or arrival in format YYYY-MM-DD. Default value: current date

args.name: time
args.description: Time of departure or arrival in format hh:mm:ss. Default value: current time

args.name: from
args.description:
The geographical location where the itinerary begins.  
 Use either this argument or `fromPlace`, but not both.

args.name: to
args.description:
The geographical location where the itinerary ends.  
 Use either this argument or `toPlace`, but not both.

args.name: fromPlace
args.description:
The place where the itinerary begins in format `name::place`, where `place` is either a lat,lng pair (e.g. `Pasila::60.199041,24.932928`) or a stop id (e.g. `Pasila::HSL:1000202`).  
 Use either this argument or `from`, but not both.

args.name: toPlace
args.description:
The place where the itinerary ends in format `name::place`, where `place` is either a lat,lng pair (e.g. `Pasila::60.199041,24.932928`) or a stop id (e.g. `Pasila::HSL:1000202`).  
 Use either this argument or `to`, but not both.

args.name: wheelchair
args.description: Whether the itinerary must be wheelchair accessible. Default value: false

args.name: numItineraries
args.description: The maximum number of itineraries to return. Default value: 3.

args.name: maxWalkDistance
args.description:
The maximum distance (in meters) the user is willing to walk per walking section. If the only transport mode allowed is `WALK`, then the value of this argument is ignored.  
 Default: 2000m  
 Maximum value: 15000m  
 **Note:** If this argument has a relatively small value and only some transport modes are allowed (e.g. `WALK` and `RAIL`), it is possible to get an itinerary which has (useless) back and forth public transport legs to avoid walking too long distances.

args.name: maxPreTransitTime
args.description: The maximum time (in seconds) of pre-transit travel when using drive-to-transit (park and ride or kiss and ride). Default value: 1800.

args.name: maxSlope
args.description: The maximum slope, up or downhill, that can be used in wheelchair accessible routing. Value is between 0 and 1, and calculated by dividing change of elevation by change of distance. Default value: 0.0833333333333

args.name: carParkCarLegWeight
args.description: How expensive it is to drive a car when car&parking, increase this value to make car driving legs shorter. Default value: 1.

args.name: itineraryFiltering
args.description: How easily bad itineraries are filtered from results. Value 0 (default) disables filtering. Itineraries are filtered if they are worse than another one in some respect (e.g. more walking) by more than the percentage of filtering level, which is calculated by dividing 100% by the value of this argument (e.g. `itineraryFiltering = 0.5` → 200% worse itineraries are filtered).

args.name: walkReluctance
args.description: A multiplier for how bad walking is, compared to being in transit for equal lengths of time.Empirically, values between 10 and 20 seem to correspond well to the concept of not wanting to walk too much without asking for totally ridiculous itineraries, but this observation should in no way be taken as scientific or definitive. Your mileage may vary. Default value: 2.0

args.name: walkOnStreetReluctance
args.description: How much more reluctant is the user to walk on streets with car traffic allowed. Default value: 1.0

args.name: waitReluctance
args.description: How much worse is waiting for a transit vehicle than being on a transit vehicle, as a multiplier. The default value treats wait and on-vehicle time as the same. It may be tempting to set this higher than walkReluctance (as studies often find this kind of preferences among riders) but the planner will take this literally and walk down a transit line to avoid waiting at a stop. This used to be set less than 1 (0.95) which would make waiting offboard preferable to waiting onboard in an interlined trip. That is also undesirable. If we only tried the shortest possible transfer at each stop to neighboring stop patterns, this problem could disappear. Default value: 1.0.

args.name: waitAtBeginningFactor
args.description: How much less bad is waiting at the beginning of the trip (replaces `waitReluctance` on the first boarding). Default value: 0.4

args.name: walkSpeed
args.description: Max walk speed along streets, in meters per second. Default value: 1.33

args.name: bikeSpeed
args.description: Max bike speed along streets, in meters per second. Default value: 5.0

args.name: bikeSwitchTime
args.description: Time to get on and off your own bike, in seconds. Default value: 0

args.name: bikeSwitchCost
args.description: Cost of getting on and off your own bike. Unit: seconds. Default value: 0

args.name: optimize
args.description: Optimization type for bicycling legs, e.g. prefer flat terrain. Default value: `GREENWAYS`

args.name: triangle
args.description: Triangle optimization parameters for bicycling legs. Only effective when `optimize` is set to **TRIANGLE**.

args.name: arriveBy
args.description: Whether the itinerary should depart at the specified time (false), or arrive to the destination at the specified time (true). Default value: false.

args.name: intermediatePlaces
args.description: An ordered list of intermediate locations to be visited.

args.name: preferred
args.description: List of routes and agencies which are given higher preference when planning the itinerary

args.name: unpreferred
args.description: List of routes and agencies which are given lower preference when planning the itinerary

args.name: walkBoardCost
args.description: This prevents unnecessary transfers by adding a cost for boarding a vehicle. Unit: seconds. Default value: 600

args.name: bikeBoardCost
args.description: Separate cost for boarding a vehicle with a bicycle, which is more difficult than on foot. Unit: seconds. Default value: 600

args.name: banned
args.description: List of routes, trips, agencies and stops which are not used in the itinerary

args.name: transferPenalty
args.description: An extra penalty added on transfers (i.e. all boardings except the first one). Not to be confused with bikeBoardCost and walkBoardCost, which are the cost of boarding a vehicle with and without a bicycle. The boardCosts are used to model the 'usual' perceived cost of using a transit vehicle, and the transferPenalty is used when a user requests even less transfers. In the latter case, we don't actually optimize for fewest transfers, as this can lead to absurd results. Consider a trip in New York from Grand Army Plaza (the one in Brooklyn) to Kalustyan's at noon. The true lowest transfers route is to wait until midnight, when the 4 train runs local the whole way. The actual fastest route is the 2/3 to the 4/5 at Nevins to the 6 at Union Square, which takes half an hour. Even someone optimizing for fewest transfers doesn't want to wait until midnight. Maybe they would be willing to walk to 7th Ave and take the Q to Union Square, then transfer to the 6. If this takes less than optimize_transfer_penalty seconds, then that's what we'll return. Default value: 0.

args.name: batch
args.description:
This argument has no use for itinerary planning and will be removed later.  
 ~~When true, do not use goal direction or stop at the target, build a full SPT. Default value: false.~~

args.name: modes
args.description:
Deprecated, use `transportModes` instead.  
 ~~The set of TraverseModes that a user is willing to use. Default value: WALK | TRANSIT.~~

args.name: transportModes
args.description: List of transportation modes that the user is willing to use. Default: `["WALK","TRANSIT"]`

args.name: modeWeight
args.description: The weight multipliers for transit modes. WALK, BICYCLE, CAR, TRANSIT and LEG_SWITCH are not included.

args.name: allowBikeRental
args.description: Is bike rental allowed? Default value: false

args.name: boardSlack
args.description: Invariant: `boardSlack + alightSlack <= transferSlack`. Default value: 0

args.name: alightSlack
args.description: Invariant: `boardSlack + alightSlack <= transferSlack`. Default value: 0

args.name: minTransferTime
args.description: A global minimum transfer time (in seconds) that specifies the minimum amount of time that must pass between exiting one transit vehicle and boarding another. This time is in addition to time it might take to walk between transit stops. Default value: 0

args.name: nonpreferredTransferPenalty
args.description: Penalty (in seconds) for using a non-preferred transfer. Default value: 180

args.name: maxTransfers
args.description: Maximum number of transfers. Default value: 2

args.name: startTransitStopId
args.description:
This argument has currently no effect on which itineraries are returned. Use argument `fromPlace` to start the itinerary from a specific stop.  
 ~~A transit stop that this trip must start from~~

args.name: startTransitTripId
args.description:
ID of the trip on which the itinerary starts. This argument can be used to plan itineraries when the user is already onboard a vehicle. When using this argument, arguments `time` and `from` should be set based on a vehicle position message received from the vehicle running the specified trip.  
 **Note:** this argument only takes into account the route and estimated travel time of the trip (and therefore arguments `time` and `from` must be used correctly to get meaningful itineraries).

args.name: claimInitialWait
args.description:
No effect on itinerary planning, adjust argument `time` instead to get later departures.  
 ~~The maximum wait time in seconds the user is willing to delay trip start. Only effective in Analyst.~~

args.name: reverseOptimizeOnTheFly
args.description:
**Consider this argument experimental** – setting this argument to true causes timeouts and unoptimal routes in many cases.  
 When true, reverse optimize (find alternative transportation mode, which still arrives to the destination in time) this search on the fly after processing each transit leg, rather than reverse-optimizing the entire path when it's done. Default value: false.

args.name: omitCanceled
args.description: When false, return itineraries using canceled trips. Default value: true.

args.name: ignoreRealtimeUpdates
args.description: When true, realtime updates are ignored during this search. Default value: false

args.name: disableRemainingWeightHeuristic
args.description:
Only useful for testing and troubleshooting.  
 ~~If true, the remaining weight heuristic is disabled. Currently only implemented for the long distance path service. Default value: false.~~

args.name: locale
args.description:
Two-letter language code (ISO 639-1) used for returned text.  
 **Note:** only part of the data has translations available and names of stops and POIs are returned in their default language. Due to missing translations, it is sometimes possible that returned text uses a mixture of two languages.

args.name: ticketTypes
args.description:
**Deprecated:** Use `allowedTicketTypes` instead.  
A comma-separated list of allowed ticket types.

args.name: allowedTicketTypes
args.description:
List of ticket types that are allowed to be used in itineraries.  
See `ticketTypes` query for list of possible ticket types.

args.name: heuristicStepsPerMainStep
args.description: Tuning parameter for the search algorithm, mainly useful for testing.

args.name: compactLegsByReversedSearch
args.description:
Whether legs should be compacted by performing a reversed search.  
 **Experimental argument, will be removed!**

args.name: allowedBikeRentalNetworks
args.description: Which bike rental networks can be used. By default, all networks are allowed.

types.name: Node
types.description: An object with an ID

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of an object

types.name: ID
types.description: Built-in ID

types.name: Feed
types.description: A feed provides routing data (stops, routes, timetables, etc.) from one or more public transport agencies.

fields.name: feedId
fields.description: ID of the feed

fields.name: agencies
fields.description: List of agencies which provide data to this feed

types.name: String
types.description: Built-in String

types.name: Agency
types.description: A public transport agency

fields.name: id
fields.description: Global object ID provided by Relay. This value can be used to refetch this object using **node** query.

fields.name: gtfsId
fields.description: Agency feed and id

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the agency

fields.name: url
fields.description: URL to the home page of the agency

fields.name: timezone
fields.description: ID of the time zone which this agency operates on

fields.name: phone
fields.description: Phone number which customers can use to contact this agency

fields.name: fareUrl
fields.description: URL to a web page which has information of fares used by this agency

fields.name: routes
fields.description: List of routes operated by this agency

fields.name: alerts
fields.description: List of alerts which have an effect on all operations of the agency (e.g. a strike)

types.name: Route
types.description: Route represents a public transportation service, usually from point A to point B and *back*, shown to customers under a single name, e.g. bus 550. Routes contain patterns (see field `patterns`), which describe different variants of the route, e.g. outbound pattern from point A to point B and inbound pattern from point B to point A.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Global object ID provided by Relay. This value can be used to refetch this object using **node** query.

fields.name: gtfsId
fields.description: ID of the route in format `FeedId:RouteId`

fields.name: agency
fields.description: Agency operating the route

fields.name: shortName
fields.description: Short name of the route, usually a line number, e.g. 550

fields.name: longName
fields.description: Long name of the route, e.g. Helsinki-Leppävaara

fields.name: mode
fields.description: Transport mode of this route, e.g. `BUS`

fields.name: type
fields.description: The raw GTFS route type as a integer. For the list of possible values, see: https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs/reference/#routestxt and https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs/reference/extended-route-types

fields.name: color
fields.description: The color (in hexadecimal format) the agency operating this route would prefer to use on UI elements (e.g. polylines on a map) related to this route. This value is not available for most routes.

fields.name: textColor
fields.description: The color (in hexadecimal format) the agency operating this route would prefer to use when displaying text related to this route. This value is not available for most routes.

fields.name: patterns
fields.description: List of patterns which operate on this route

fields.name: stops
fields.description: List of stops on this route

fields.name: trips
fields.description: List of trips which operate on this route

fields.name: alerts
fields.description: List of alerts which have an effect on the route

enumValues.name: LEG_SWITCH
enumValues.description: Only used internally. No use for API users.

enumValues.name: TRANSIT
enumValues.description: A special transport mode, which includes all public transport.

types.name: Int
types.description: Built-in Int

enumValues.name: NO_INFORMATION
enumValues.description: There is no bike information for the trip.

enumValues.name: ALLOWED
enumValues.description: The vehicle being used on this particular trip can accommodate at least one bicycle.

enumValues.name: NOT_ALLOWED
enumValues.description: No bicycles are allowed on this trip.

types.name: Pattern
types.description: Pattern is sequence of stops used by trips on a specific direction and variant of a route. Most routes have only two patterns: one for outbound trips and one for inbound trips

fields.name: id
fields.description: Global object ID provided by Relay. This value can be used to refetch this object using **node** query.

fields.name: route
fields.description: The route this pattern runs on

fields.name: directionId
fields.description:
Direction of the pattern. Possible values: 0, 1 or -1.  
 -1 indicates that the direction is irrelevant, i.e. the route has patterns only in one direction.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the pattern. Pattern name can be just the name of the route or it can include details of destination and origin stops.

fields.name: code
fields.description: ID of the pattern

fields.name: headsign
fields.description: Vehicle headsign used by trips of this pattern

fields.name: trips
fields.description: Trips which run on this pattern

fields.name: tripsForDate
fields.description: Trips which run on this pattern on the specified date

args.name: serviceDay
args.description: Deprecated, please switch to serviceDate instead

args.name: serviceDate
args.description: Return trips of the pattern active on this date. Format: YYYYMMDD

fields.name: stops
fields.description: List of stops served by this pattern

fields.name: patternGeometry
fields.description: Coordinates of the route of this pattern in Google polyline encoded format

fields.name: semanticHash
fields.description: Hash code of the pattern. This value is stable and not dependent on the pattern id, i.e. this value can be used to check whether two patterns are the same, even if their ids have changed.

fields.name: alerts
fields.description: List of alerts which have an effect on trips of the pattern

types.name: Trip
types.description: Trip is a specific occurance of a pattern, usually identified by route, direction on the route and exact departure time.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Global object ID provided by Relay. This value can be used to refetch this object using **node** query.

fields.name: gtfsId
fields.description: ID of the trip in format `FeedId:TripId`

fields.name: route
fields.description: The route the trip is running on

fields.name: activeDates
fields.description: List of dates when this trip is in service. Format: YYYYMMDD

fields.name: tripHeadsign
fields.description: Headsign of the vehicle when running on this trip

fields.name: routeShortName
fields.description: Short name of the route this trip is running. See field `shortName` of Route.

fields.name: directionId
fields.description: Direction code of the trip, i.e. is this the outbound or inbound trip of a pattern. Possible values: 0, 1 or `null` if the direction is irrelevant, i.e. the pattern has trips only in one direction.

fields.name: wheelchairAccessible
fields.description: Whether the vehicle running this trip can be boarded by a wheelchair

fields.name: bikesAllowed
fields.description: Whether bikes are allowed on board the vehicle running this trip

fields.name: pattern
fields.description: The pattern the trip is running on

fields.name: stops
fields.description: List of stops this trip passes through

fields.name: semanticHash
fields.description: Hash code of the trip. This value is stable and not dependent on the trip id.

fields.name: stoptimes
fields.description: List of times when this trip arrives to or departs from a stop

fields.name: departureStoptime
fields.description: Departure time from the first stop

args.name: serviceDate
args.description: Date for which the departure time is returned. Format: YYYYMMDD. If this argument is not used, field `serviceDay` in the stoptime will have a value of 0.

fields.name: arrivalStoptime
fields.description: Arrival time to the final stop

args.name: serviceDate
args.description: Date for which the arrival time is returned. Format: YYYYMMDD. If this argument is not used, field `serviceDay` in the stoptime will have a value of 0.

args.name: serviceDay
args.description: Deprecated, please switch to serviceDate instead

args.name: serviceDate
args.description: Date for which stoptimes are returned. Format: YYYYMMDD

fields.name: geometry
fields.description: List of coordinates of this trip's route

fields.name: tripGeometry
fields.description: Coordinates of the route of this trip in Google polyline encoded format

fields.name: alerts
fields.description: List of alerts which have an effect on this trip

enumValues.name: NO_INFORMATION
enumValues.description: There is no accessibility information for the stop.

enumValues.name: POSSIBLE
enumValues.description: At least some vehicles at this stop can be boarded by a rider in a wheelchair.

enumValues.name: NOT_POSSIBLE
enumValues.description: Wheelchair boarding is not possible at this stop.

types.name: Stop
types.description: Stop can represent either a single public transport stop, where passengers can board and/or disembark vehicles, or a station, which contains multiple stops. See field `locationType`.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Global object ID provided by Relay. This value can be used to refetch this object using **node** query.

fields.name: stopTimesForPattern
fields.description: Returns timetable of the specified pattern at this stop

args.name: id
args.description: Id of the pattern

args.name: startTime
args.description: Return  departures after this time. Format: Unix timestamp in seconds. Default value: current time

args.name: timeRange
args.description: Return stoptimes within this time range, starting from `startTime`. Unit: Seconds

args.name: omitNonPickups
args.description: If true, only those departures which allow boarding are returned

args.name: omitCanceled
args.description: If false, returns also canceled trips

fields.name: gtfsId
fields.description: ÌD of the stop in format `FeedId:StopId`

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the stop, e.g. Pasilan asema

fields.name: lat
fields.description: Latitude of the stop (WGS 84)

fields.name: lon
fields.description: Longitude of the stop (WGS 84)

fields.name: code
fields.description: Stop code which is visible at the stop

fields.name: desc
fields.description: Description of the stop, usually a street name

fields.name: zoneId
fields.description: ID of the zone where this stop is located

fields.name: locationType
fields.description: Identifies whether this stop represents a stop or station.

fields.name: parentStation
fields.description: The station which this stop is part of (or null if this stop is not part of a station)

fields.name: wheelchairBoarding
fields.description: Whether wheelchair boarding is possible for at least some of vehicles on this stop

fields.name: vehicleType
fields.description: The raw GTFS route type used by routes which pass through this stop. For the list of possible values, see: https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs/reference/#routestxt and https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs/reference/extended-route-types

fields.name: vehicleMode
fields.description:
Transport mode (e.g. `BUS`) used by routes which pass through this stop or `null` if mode cannot be determined, e.g. in case no routes pass through the stop.  
 Note that also other types of vehicles may use the stop, e.g. tram replacement buses might use stops which have `TRAM` as their mode.

fields.name: platformCode
fields.description: Identifier of the platform, usually a number. This value is only present for stops that are part of a station

fields.name: cluster
fields.description: The cluster which this stop is part of

fields.name: stops
fields.description: Returns all stops that are children of this station (Only applicable for stations)

fields.name: routes
fields.description: Routes which pass through this stop

fields.name: patterns
fields.description: Patterns which pass through this stop

fields.name: transfers
fields.description: List of nearby stops which can be used for transfers

args.name: maxDistance
args.description:
Maximum distance to the transfer stop. Defaults to unlimited.  
 **Note:** only stops that are linked as a transfer stops to this stop are returned, i.e. this does not do a query to search for *all* stops within radius of `maxDistance`.

fields.name: stoptimesForServiceDate
fields.description: Returns list of stoptimes for the specified date

args.name: date
args.description: Date in format YYYYMMDD

args.name: omitNonPickups
args.description: If true, only those departures which allow boarding are returned

args.name: omitCanceled
args.description: If false, returns also canceled trips

fields.name: stoptimesForPatterns
fields.description: Returns list of stoptimes (arrivals and departures) at this stop, grouped by patterns

args.name: startTime
args.description: Return departures after this time. Format: Unix timestamp in seconds. Default value: current time

args.name: timeRange
args.description: Return stoptimes within this time range, starting from `startTime`. Unit: Seconds

args.name: omitNonPickups
args.description: If true, only those departures which allow boarding are returned

args.name: omitCanceled
args.description: If false, returns also canceled trips

fields.name: stoptimesWithoutPatterns
fields.description: Returns list of stoptimes (arrivals and departures) at this stop

args.name: startTime
args.description: Return departures after this time. Format: Unix timestamp in seconds. Default value: current time

args.name: timeRange
args.description: Return stoptimes within this time range, starting from `startTime`. Unit: Seconds

args.name: omitNonPickups
args.description: If true, only those departures which allow boarding are returned

args.name: omitCanceled
args.description: If false, returns also canceled trips

fields.name: alerts
fields.description: List of alerts which have an effect on this stop

types.name: Long
types.description: Long type

types.name: Boolean
types.description: Built-in Boolean

types.name: Float
types.description: Built-in Float

types.name: LocationType
types.description: Identifies whether this stop represents a stop or station.

enumValues.name: STOP
enumValues.description: A location where passengers board or disembark from a transit vehicle.

enumValues.name: STATION
enumValues.description: A physical structure or area that contains one or more stop.

types.name: Cluster
types.description: Cluster is a list of stops grouped by name and proximity

fields.name: id
fields.description: Global object ID provided by Relay. This value can be used to refetch this object using **node** query.

fields.name: gtfsId
fields.description: ID of the cluster

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the cluster

fields.name: lat
fields.description: Latitude of the center of this cluster (i.e. average latitude of stops in this cluster)

fields.name: lon
fields.description: Longitude of the center of this cluster (i.e. average longitude of stops in this cluster)

fields.name: stops
fields.description: List of stops in the cluster

fields.name: id
fields.description: Global object ID provided by Relay. This value can be used to refetch this object using **node** query.

fields.name: distance
fields.description: Walking distance to the stop along streets and paths

types.name: StoptimesInPattern
types.description: Stoptimes grouped by pattern

types.name: Alert
types.description: Alert of a current or upcoming disruption in public transportation

fields.name: id
fields.description: Global object ID provided by Relay. This value can be used to refetch this object using **node** query.

fields.name: alertHash
fields.description: hashcode from the original GTFS-RT alert

fields.name: feed
fields.description: The feed in which this alert was published

fields.name: agency
fields.description: Agency affected by the disruption. Note that this value is present only if the disruption has an effect on all operations of the agency (e.g. in case of a strike).

fields.name: route
fields.description: Route affected by the disruption

fields.name: trip
fields.description: Trip affected by the disruption

fields.name: stop
fields.description: Stop affected by the disruption

fields.name: patterns
fields.description: Patterns affected by the disruption

fields.name: alertHeaderText
fields.description: Header of the alert, if available

fields.name: alertHeaderTextTranslations
fields.description: Header of the alert in all different available languages

fields.name: alertDescriptionText
fields.description: Long description of the alert

fields.name: alertDescriptionTextTranslations
fields.description: Long descriptions of the alert in all different available languages

fields.name: alertUrl
fields.description: Url with more information

fields.name: alertUrlTranslations
fields.description: Url with more information in all different available languages

fields.name: alertEffect
fields.description: Alert effect

fields.name: alertCause
fields.description: Alert cause

fields.name: alertSeverityLevel
fields.description: Alert severity level

fields.name: effectiveStartDate
fields.description: Time when this alert comes into effect. Format: Unix timestamp in seconds

fields.name: effectiveEndDate
fields.description: Time when this alert is not in effect anymore. Format: Unix timestamp in seconds

types.name: TranslatedString
types.description: Text with language

fields.name: language
fields.description: Two-letter language code (ISO 639-1)

types.name: AlertEffectType
types.description: Effect of a alert

types.name: AlertCauseType
types.description: Cause of a alert

types.name: AlertSeverityLevelType
types.description: Severity level of a alert

enumValues.name: INFO
enumValues.description: Info alerts are used for informational messages that should not have a significant effect on user's journey, for example: A single entrance to a metro station is temporarily closed.

enumValues.name: WARNING
enumValues.description: Warning alerts are used when a single stop or route has a disruption that can affect user's journey, for example: All trams on a specific route are running with irregular schedules.

enumValues.name: SEVERE
enumValues.description: Severe alerts are used when a significant part of public transport services is affected, for example: All train services are cancelled due to technical problems.

types.name: PlaceInterface
types.description: Interface for places, e.g. stops, stations, parking areas..

fields.name: lat
fields.description: Latitude of the place (WGS 84)

fields.name: lon
fields.description: Longitude of the place (WGS 84)

types.name: Stoptime
types.description: Stoptime represents the time when a specific trip arrives to or departs from a specific stop.

fields.name: stop
fields.description: The stop where this arrival/departure happens

fields.name: scheduledArrival
fields.description: Scheduled arrival time. Format: seconds since midnight of the departure date

fields.name: realtimeArrival
fields.description: Realtime prediction of arrival time. Format: seconds since midnight of the departure date

fields.name: arrivalDelay
fields.description: The offset from the scheduled arrival time in seconds. Negative values indicate that the trip is running ahead of schedule.

fields.name: scheduledDeparture
fields.description: Scheduled departure time. Format: seconds since midnight of the departure date

fields.name: realtimeDeparture
fields.description: Realtime prediction of departure time. Format: seconds since midnight of the departure date

fields.name: departureDelay
fields.description: The offset from the scheduled departure time in seconds. Negative values indicate that the trip is running ahead of schedule

fields.name: timepoint
fields.description: true, if this stop is used as a time equalization stop. false otherwise.

fields.name: realtime
fields.description: true, if this stoptime has real-time data available

fields.name: realtimeState
fields.description: State of real-time data

fields.name: pickupType
fields.description: Whether the vehicle can be boarded at this stop. This field can also be used to indicate if boarding is possible only with special arrangements.

fields.name: dropoffType
fields.description: Whether the vehicle can be disembarked at this stop. This field can also be used to indicate if disembarkation is possible only with special arrangements.

fields.name: serviceDay
fields.description: Departure date of the trip. Format: Unix timestamp (local time) in seconds.

fields.name: trip
fields.description: Trip which this stoptime is for

fields.name: stopHeadsign
fields.deprecationReason: Use headsign instead, will be removed in the future

fields.name: headsign
fields.description: Vehicle headsign of the trip on this stop. Trip headsigns can change during the trip (e.g. on routes which run on loops), so this value should be used instead of `tripHeadsign` to display the headsign relevant to the user.

enumValues.name: SCHEDULED
enumValues.description: The trip information comes from the GTFS feed, i.e. no real-time update has been applied.

enumValues.name: UPDATED
enumValues.description: The trip information has been updated, but the trip pattern stayed the same as the trip pattern of the scheduled trip.

enumValues.name: CANCELED
enumValues.description: The trip has been canceled by a real-time update.

enumValues.name: ADDED
enumValues.description: The trip has been added using a real-time update, i.e. the trip was not present in the GTFS feed.

enumValues.name: MODIFIED
enumValues.description: The trip information has been updated and resulted in a different trip pattern compared to the trip pattern of the scheduled trip.

enumValues.name: CALL_AGENCY
enumValues.description: Must phone agency to arrange pickup / drop off.

enumValues.name: COORDINATE_WITH_DRIVER
enumValues.description: Must coordinate with driver to arrange pickup / drop off.

fields.name: length
fields.description: The number of points in the string

fields.name: points
fields.description: List of coordinates of in a Google encoded polyline format (see https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/utilities/polylinealgorithm)

types.name: Polyline
types.description: List of coordinates in an encoded polyline format (see https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/utilities/polylinealgorithm). The value appears in JSON as a string.

fields.name: lat
fields.description: Latitude (WGS 84)

fields.name: lon
fields.description: Longitude (WGS 84)

types.name: TicketType
types.description: Describes ticket type

fields.name: id
fields.description: Global object ID provided by Relay. This value can be used to refetch this object using **node** query.

fields.name: fareId
fields.description: Ticket type ID in format `FeedId:TicketTypeId`. Ticket type IDs are usually combination of ticket zones where the ticket is valid.

fields.name: price
fields.description: Price of the ticket in currency that is specified in `currency` field

fields.name: currency
fields.description: ISO 4217 currency code

fields.name: zones
fields.description:
List of zones where this ticket is valid.
  Corresponds to field `zoneId` in **Stop** type.

types.name: stopAtDistanceConnection
types.description: A connection to a list of items.

types.name: stopAtDistanceEdge
types.description: An edge in a connection.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge

types.name: PageInfo
types.description: Information about pagination in a connection.

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: When paginating forwards, are there more items?

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: When paginating backwards, are there more items?

fields.name: startCursor
fields.description: When paginating backwards, the cursor to continue.

fields.name: endCursor
fields.description: When paginating forwards, the cursor to continue.

types.name: placeAtDistanceConnection
types.description: A connection to a list of items.

types.name: placeAtDistanceEdge
types.description: An edge in a connection.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge

fields.name: id
fields.description: Global object ID provided by Relay. This value can be used to refetch this object using **node** query.

fields.name: distance
fields.description: Walking distance to the place along streets and paths

inputFields.name: stops
inputFields.description: Stops to include by GTFS id.

inputFields.name: routes
inputFields.description: Routes to include by GTFS id.

inputFields.name: bikeRentalStations
inputFields.description: Bike rentals to include by id.

inputFields.name: bikeParks
inputFields.description: Bike parks to include by id.

inputFields.name: carParks
inputFields.description: Car parks to include by id.

types.name: DepartureRow
types.description: Departure row is a location, which lists departures of a certain pattern from a stop. Departure rows are identified with the pattern, so querying departure rows will return only departures from one stop per pattern

fields.name: id
fields.description: Global object ID provided by Relay. This value can be used to refetch this object using **node** query.

fields.name: stop
fields.description: Stop from which the departures leave

fields.name: lat
fields.description: Latitude of the stop (WGS 84)

fields.name: lon
fields.description: Longitude of the stop (WGS 84)

fields.name: pattern
fields.description: Pattern of the departure row

fields.name: stoptimes
fields.description: Departures of the pattern from the stop

args.name: startTime
args.description: Return rows departing after this time. Time format: Unix timestamp in seconds. Default: current time.

args.name: timeRange
args.description: How many seconds ahead to search for departures. Default is one day.

args.name: numberOfDepartures
args.description: Maximum number of departures to return.

args.name: omitNonPickups
args.description: If true, only those departures which allow boarding are returned

args.name: omitCanceled
args.description: If false, returns also canceled trips

types.name: serviceTimeRange
types.description: Time range for which the API has data available

fields.name: start
fields.description: Time from which the API has data available. Format: Unix timestamp in seconds

fields.name: end
fields.description: Time until which the API has data available. Format: Unix timestamp in seconds

types.name: BikeRentalStation
types.description: Bike rental station represents a location where users can rent bicycles for a fee.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Global object ID provided by Relay. This value can be used to refetch this object using **node** query.

fields.name: stationId
fields.description: ID of the bike rental station

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the bike rental station

fields.name: bikesAvailable
fields.description: Number of bikes currently available on the rental station. The total capacity of this bike rental station is the sum of fields `bikesAvailable` and `spacesAvailable`.

fields.name: spacesAvailable
fields.description:
Number of free spaces currently available on the rental station. The total capacity of this bike rental station is the sum of fields `bikesAvailable` and `spacesAvailable`.  
 Note that this value being 0 does not necessarily indicate that bikes cannot be returned to this station, as it might be possible to leave the bike in the vicinity of the rental station, even if the bike racks don't have any spaces available (see field `allowDropoff`).

fields.name: state
fields.description: A description of the current state of this bike rental station, e.g. "Station on"

fields.name: realtime
fields.description: If true, values of `bikesAvailable` and `spacesAvailable` are updated from a real-time source. If false, values of `bikesAvailable` and `spacesAvailable` are always the total capacity divided by two.

fields.name: allowDropoff
fields.description: If true, bikes can be returned to this station.

fields.name: lon
fields.description: Longitude of the bike rental station (WGS 84)

fields.name: lat
fields.description: Latitude of the bike rental station (WGS 84)

types.name: BikePark
types.description: Bike park represents a location where bicycles can be parked.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Global object ID provided by Relay. This value can be used to refetch this object using **node** query.

fields.name: bikeParkId
fields.description: ID of the bike park

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the bike park

fields.name: spacesAvailable
fields.description: Number of spaces available for bikes

fields.name: realtime
fields.description: If true, value of `spacesAvailable` is updated from a real-time source.

fields.name: lon
fields.description: Longitude of the bike park (WGS 84)

fields.name: lat
fields.description: Latitude of the bike park (WGS 84)

types.name: CarPark
types.description: Car park represents a location where cars can be parked.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Global object ID provided by Relay. This value can be used to refetch this object using **node** query.

fields.name: carParkId
fields.description: ID of the car park

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the car park

fields.name: maxCapacity
fields.description: Number of parking spaces at the car park

fields.name: spacesAvailable
fields.description: Number of currently available parking spaces at the car park

fields.name: realtime
fields.description: If true, value of `spacesAvailable` is updated from a real-time source.

fields.name: lon
fields.description: Longitude of the car park (WGS 84)

fields.name: lat
fields.description: Latitude of the car park (WGS 84)

fields.name: date
fields.description: The time and date of travel. Format: Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

fields.name: from
fields.description: The origin

fields.name: to
fields.description: The destination

fields.name: itineraries
fields.description: A list of possible itineraries

fields.name: messageEnums
fields.description: A list of possible error messages as enum

fields.name: messageStrings
fields.description: A list of possible error messages in cleartext

fields.name: debugOutput
fields.description: Information about the timings for the plan generation

fields.name: name
fields.description: For transit stops, the name of the stop. For points of interest, the name of the POI.

fields.name: vertexType
fields.description: Type of vertex. (Normal, Bike sharing station, Bike P+R, Transit stop) Mostly used for better localization of bike sharing and P+R station names

fields.name: lat
fields.description: Latitude of the place (WGS 84)

fields.name: lon
fields.description: Longitude of the place (WGS 84)

fields.name: arrivalTime
fields.description: The time the rider will arrive at the place. Format: Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

fields.name: departureTime
fields.description: The time the rider will depart the place. Format: Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

fields.name: stop
fields.description: The stop related to the place.

fields.name: bikeRentalStation
fields.description: The bike rental station related to the place

fields.name: bikePark
fields.description: The bike parking related to the place

fields.name: carPark
fields.description: The car parking related to the place

fields.name: startTime
fields.description: Time when the user leaves from the origin. Format: Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

fields.name: endTime
fields.description: Time when the user arrives to the destination.. Format: Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Duration of the trip on this itinerary, in seconds.

fields.name: waitingTime
fields.description: How much time is spent waiting for transit to arrive, in seconds.

fields.name: walkTime
fields.description: How much time is spent walking, in seconds.

fields.name: walkDistance
fields.description: How far the user has to walk, in meters.

fields.name: legs
fields.description: A list of Legs. Each Leg is either a walking (cycling, car) portion of the itinerary, or a transit leg on a particular vehicle. So a itinerary where the user walks to the Q train, transfers to the 6, then walks to their destination, has four legs.

fields.name: fares
fields.description: Information about the fares for this itinerary

fields.name: elevationGained
fields.description: How much elevation is gained, in total, over the course of the itinerary, in meters.

fields.name: elevationLost
fields.description: How much elevation is lost, in total, over the course of the itinerary, in meters.

fields.name: startTime
fields.description: The date and time when this leg begins. Format: Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

fields.name: endTime
fields.description: The date and time when this leg ends. Format: Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

fields.name: departureDelay
fields.description: For transit leg, the offset from the scheduled departure time of the boarding stop in this leg, i.e. scheduled time of departure at boarding stop = `startTime - departureDelay`

fields.name: arrivalDelay
fields.description: For transit leg, the offset from the scheduled arrival time of the alighting stop in this leg, i.e. scheduled time of arrival at alighting stop = `endTime - arrivalDelay`

fields.name: mode
fields.description: The mode (e.g. `WALK`) used when traversing this leg.

fields.name: duration
fields.description: The leg's duration in seconds

fields.name: legGeometry
fields.description: The leg's geometry.

fields.name: agency
fields.description: For transit legs, the transit agency that operates the service used for this leg. For non-transit legs, `null`.

fields.name: realTime
fields.description: Whether there is real-time data about this Leg

fields.name: realtimeState
fields.description: State of real-time data

fields.name: distance
fields.description: The distance traveled while traversing the leg in meters.

fields.name: transitLeg
fields.description: Whether this leg is a transit leg or not.

fields.name: rentedBike
fields.description: Whether this leg is traversed with a rented bike.

fields.name: from
fields.description: The Place where the leg originates.

fields.name: to
fields.description: The Place where the leg ends.

fields.name: route
fields.description: For transit legs, the route that is used for traversing the leg. For non-transit legs, `null`.

fields.name: trip
fields.description: For transit legs, the trip that is used for traversing the leg. For non-transit legs, `null`.

fields.name: serviceDate
fields.description: For transit legs, the service date of the trip. Format: YYYYMMDD. For non-transit legs, null.

fields.name: intermediateStops
fields.description: For transit legs, intermediate stops between the Place where the leg originates and the Place where the leg ends. For non-transit legs, null.

fields.name: intermediatePlaces
fields.description: For transit legs, intermediate stops between the Place where the leg originates and the Place where the leg ends. For non-transit legs, null. Returns Place type, which has fields for e.g. departure and arrival times

fields.name: intermediatePlace
fields.description: Whether the destination of this leg (field `to`) is one of the intermediate places specified in the query.

fields.name: distance
fields.description: The distance in meters that this step takes.

fields.name: lon
fields.description: The longitude of the start of the step.

fields.name: lat
fields.description: The latitude of the start of the step.

fields.name: elevationProfile
fields.description: The elevation profile as a list of { distance, elevation } values.

fields.name: distance
fields.description: The distance from the start of the step, in meters.

fields.name: elevation
fields.description: The elevation at this distance, in meters.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: ISO 4217 currency code

fields.name: cents
fields.description: Fare price in cents. **Note:** this value is dependent on the currency used, as one cent is not necessarily ¹/₁₀₀ of the basic monerary unit.

fields.name: components
fields.description: Components which this fare is composed of

types.name: fareComponent
types.description: Component of the fare (i.e. ticket) for a part of the itinerary

fields.name: fareId
fields.description: ID of the ticket type. Corresponds to `fareId` in **TicketType**.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: ISO 4217 currency code

fields.name: cents
fields.description: Fare price in cents. **Note:** this value is dependent on the currency used, as one cent is not necessarily ¹/₁₀₀ of the basic monerary unit.

fields.name: routes
fields.description: List of routes which use this fare component

inputFields.name: lat
inputFields.description: Latitude of the place (WGS 84)

inputFields.name: lon
inputFields.description: Longitude of the place (WGS 84)

inputFields.name: address
inputFields.description: The name of the place. If specified, the place name in results uses this value instead of `"Origin"` or `"Destination"`

inputFields.name: locationSlack
inputFields.description: The amount of time, in seconds, to spend at this location before venturing forth.

types.name: OptimizeType
types.description: Optimization type for bicycling legs

enumValues.name: SAFE
enumValues.description: Prefer safer routes, i.e. avoid crossing streets and use bike paths when possible

enumValues.name: TRIANGLE
enumValues.description: **TRIANGLE** optimization type can be used to set relative preferences of optimization factors. See argument `triangle`.

enumValues.name: TRANSFERS
enumValues.description: Deprecated, use argument `transferPenalty` to optimize for less transfers.

types.name: InputTriangle
types.description:
Relative importances of optimization factors. Only effective for bicycling legs.  
 Invariant: `timeFactor + slopeFactor + safetyFactor == 1`

inputFields.name: safetyFactor
inputFields.description: Relative importance of safety

inputFields.name: slopeFactor
inputFields.description: Relative importance of flat terrain

inputFields.name: timeFactor
inputFields.description: Relative importance of duration

inputFields.name: routes
inputFields.description: A comma-separated list of ids of the routes preferred by the user.

inputFields.name: agencies
inputFields.description: A comma-separated list of ids of the agencies preferred by the user.

inputFields.name: otherThanPreferredRoutesPenalty
inputFields.description: Penalty added for using every route that is not preferred if user set any route as preferred. We return number of seconds that we are willing to wait for preferred route.

inputFields.name: routes
inputFields.description: A comma-separated list of ids of the routes unpreferred by the user.

inputFields.name: agencies
inputFields.description: A comma-separated list of ids of the agencies unpreferred by the user.

inputFields.name: useUnpreferredRoutesPenalty
inputFields.description: Penalty added for using route that is unpreferred, i.e. number of seconds that we are willing to wait for route that is unpreferred.

inputFields.name: routes
inputFields.description: A comma-separated list of banned route ids

inputFields.name: agencies
inputFields.description: A comma-separated list of banned agency ids

inputFields.name: trips
inputFields.description: A comma-separated list of banned trip ids

inputFields.name: stops
inputFields.description: A comma-separated list of banned stop ids. Note that these stops are only banned for boarding and disembarking vehicles — it is possible to get an itinerary where a vehicle stops at one of these stops

inputFields.name: stopsHard
inputFields.description: A comma-separated list of banned stop ids. Only itineraries where these stops are not travelled through are returned, e.g. if a bus route stops at one of these stops, that route will not be used in the itinerary, even if the stop is not used for boarding or disembarking the vehicle.

types.name: TransportMode
types.description: Transportation mode which can be used in the itinerary

inputFields.name: qualifier
inputFields.description: Optional additional qualifier for transport mode, e.g. `RENT`

types.name: Qualifier
types.description:
Additional qualifier for a transport mode.  
 Note that qualifiers can only be used with certain transport modes.

enumValues.name: RENT
enumValues.description: The vehicle used for transport can be rented

enumValues.name: PARK
enumValues.description:
The vehicle used must be left to a parking area before continuing the journey. This qualifier is usable with transport modes `CAR` and `BICYCLE`.  
 Note that the vehicle is only parked if the journey is continued with public transportation (e.g. if only `CAR` and `WALK` transport modes are allowed to be used, the car will not be parked as it is used for the whole journey).

enumValues.name: PICKUP
enumValues.description: The user can be picked up by someone else riding a vehicle

inputFields.name: TRAM
inputFields.description: The weight of TRAM traverse mode. Values over 1 add cost to tram travel and values under 1 decrease cost

inputFields.name: SUBWAY
inputFields.description: The weight of SUBWAY traverse mode. Values over 1 add cost to subway travel and values under 1 decrease cost

inputFields.name: RAIL
inputFields.description: The weight of RAIL traverse mode. Values over 1 add cost to rail travel and values under 1 decrease cost

inputFields.name: BUS
inputFields.description: The weight of BUS traverse mode. Values over 1 add cost to bus travel and values under 1 decrease cost

inputFields.name: FERRY
inputFields.description: The weight of FERRY traverse mode. Values over 1 add cost to ferry travel and values under 1 decrease cost

inputFields.name: CABLE_CAR
inputFields.description: The weight of CABLE_CAR traverse mode. Values over 1 add cost to cable car travel and values under 1 decrease cost

inputFields.name: GONDOLA
inputFields.description: The weight of GONDOLA traverse mode. Values over 1 add cost to gondola travel and values under 1 decrease cost

inputFields.name: FUNICULAR
inputFields.description: The weight of FUNICULAR traverse mode. Values over 1 add cost to funicular travel and values under 1 decrease cost

inputFields.name: AIRPLANE
inputFields.description: The weight of AIRPLANE traverse mode. Values over 1 add cost to airplane travel and values under 1 decrease cost

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Introspection defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: 'A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: 'If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given __Type is

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: An enum describing valid locations where a directive can be placed

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on queries.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on mutations.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fields.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fragment definitions.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fragment spreads.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on inline fragments.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if`'argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.
